dt: {bc}the imitative representation of the functioning of one system or process by means of the functioning of another

dt.t: a computer {wi}simulation{/wi} of an industrial process

dt: {bc}examination of a problem often not subject to direct experimentation by means of a simulating device

et: Middle English {it}simulacion{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}simulation-, simulatio{/it}, from {it}simulare{/it}
shortdef: the act or process of simulating
the imitative representation of the functioning of one system or process by means of the functioning of another
